meanings.sent1: The entire cake was eaten by the children.
meanings.sent2: She read the entire book in one sitting.
meanings.sent3: The entire class burst into laughter at the silly joke.
meanings.sent4: His entire world revolved around his family.
meanings.sent5: The entire sky was painted with vibrant colors during the sunset.

meanings.definition: having no element or part left out
meanings.sent1: The entire puzzle was finally completed by the team.
meanings.sent2: He wore the entire costume to the costume party.
meanings.sent3: The entire plan fell apart when the main ingredient was missing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up her entire face with joy.
meanings.sent5: The entire jigsaw puzzle was missing a single piece, making it impossible to finish.
